diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Congenital hypothyroidism and benign chorea due to TITF1/NKX2.1 mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The final diagnosis was based on the identification of a novel 825delC mutation in the TITF1/NKX2.1 gene, which was associated with the phenotypic presentation of congenital hypothyroidism and choreoathetosis in the two sisters. The mutation resulted in a nonfunctional protein that exhibited dominant-negative effects on the transcriptional activity of the wild-type TTF1 protein, which was supported by functional studies.
